SNIP

0.25 completely changed where parts are - it really doesn't matter what they do in 0.26 :-P

0.25 completely changed where parts are - it really doesn't matter what they do in 0.26 :-P

I think you are right - but still.

Hypeee!!! Train train

Not yet. Not until experimentals, which will be a long time from now.

This means there could be more than two launching sites right?
This would be interesting. One wild idea: There are houses around the original KSC, which means rockets with too much fuel or craft taking certain flightpaths will heavily hit your reputation. You can then get other sites without such effects, but maybe they're not on the equator so you have inclinations to think about.
Not yet. Not until experimentals, which will be a long time from now.
We can start hitching the loco to the carriages and loading the hype into the tender though.

Also, this should make it very simple to add a switch to the editor UI to let you simply flick between Mirror (SPH-style) or Radial (VAB-style) symmetry modes.

Please add actual part mirroring.

Please no better ISP with higher level Kerbals, that would make it very hard to share craft files since they would not work for everyone or overperform. Also its allready way to easy to get to orbit, even better ISP is just stupid. I dont care if this system changes anything about science/funds/reputation since im playing sandbox...

i'd like to see highly trained kerbals doing easier, repetitive stuff on their own (aka integrate mechjeb)

after 30 launches, jeb should be perfectly capable of going to orbit on his own or raise his orbit.

i'd like to see highly trained kerbals doing easier, repetitive stuff on their own (aka integrate mechjeb)

after 30 launches, jeb should be perfectly capable of going to orbit on his own or raise his orbit.

I like this idea.

Launching? No.

Burn nodes? Yes.

Change orbit independently? Maaaayyybeee...not.

Gather science as it becomes available? Yes. (If told to do so.)

At some point I think they need to stop worrying about some of the oddities in the game. Take the VAB/SPH, I don't know anyone that at some point jiggled the "QWEASD" keys trying to get a part into place. Its these little things that give this game its quirks. Just like the part joint strength, there's a point where it becomes 'too' stable.

Its also this games bugs I think, that made this game. From crashing into the old launch tower that didn't need to be there, to flying all the way out to Jool before realizing your craft is bugged beyond saving , and the ever present lack of memory game crash.

I think an entire generation pf PC gamers have learned so much about how their hardware actually works trying to bypass this major flaw.

So yes please Squad, continue to increase whats possible in this game, just dont forget the random physics glitching bugs that make playing this game so fun sometimes

You know how the saying goes, Squad.

Wisdom comes with age.

So, with experience being added, we can expect that the Kerbals age as well, right?

I don't like that. Please don't add aging Kerbals in 0.26. It would make journeys into the solar system really annoying.

THIS MESSAGE BROUGHT TO YOU BY WILD, BASELESS SPECULATION!

Our motto is: Wait and see before you tell a company what or what not to do.

I'm actually psyched about Kerbal XP. Along with building upgrades, it sounds like we're finally getting into the "tycoon-style gameplay" that Squad has been building towards. I'm very much looking forward to seeing what this might entail. It would surprise me if it actually offered options like automation for maneuver nodes - although, if a highly skilled pilot could perform a node perfectly, would a less-skilled pilot therefore screw up your nodes?

I'd guess it would be slight improvements to power and fuel use, and have a greater effect on science than anything else. Increasing ISP actually makes sense in the context of how KSP handles ISP (that is, it's a measure of fuel flow efficiency, as opposed to relating at all to thrust).
Kerbal XP may affect the range at which docking ports magnets attract their counterparts, making docking easier

Kerbal XP may affect the range at which docking ports magnets attract their counterparts, making docking easier

Not a single example of how astronaut experience effecting ship performance in this thread has been anything short of wincing.

Not a single example of how astronaut experience effecting ship performance in this thread has been anything short of wincing.

Hey, you want realism, don't you? Do you think rookie astronauts with unrealistic bad training perform as well as veteran astronauts?
When devs wrote that destruction is part of something bigger, I thought you'd be able to actually build the space centre. Nice to hear this is true.

Hey, you want realism, don't you? Do you think rookie astronauts with unrealistic bad training perform as well as veteran astronauts?

That's the player's learning curve you're describing. You're controlling the rocket, and I imagine you're far better at getting your junk into the sky now than you were day one. You're the astronaut.

I'll admit though the Kerbal D&D stats system is a longtime coming though, so hopefully they don't do something arcade-y like some "Lvl 12; +10 boost to ISP" buff system. All I can do is hold my breathe that Squad makes it so the astronaut experience/skills impact the game through pilot-skill-based elements and not rocket-performance-based. Otherwise I foresee a lot of [stockCraft] [Pilot Lvl 10+ Req] My Cool Plane! threads.

I like the idea of Kerbal xp being more of a qualification system. Rookies start with a base XP to buy their first certificate, and as they earn more they can 'buy' certificates for more qualifications. Certificates could be for various pods or cockpits, operating various experiments, and so on. The "Badass" certificate would be for the external command seat

LOVE THIS UPDATE. So much good stuff coming.

On the topic of Kerbals affecting flight performance:

While it sounds nice at first (my rockets fly BETTER as my Kerbals survive more disasters!), the truth is, I (the player) actually do all the flying, with the Kerbals screaming (or grinning) in the little PIPs in the corner. From a role-play perspective, sure, you can say that Jeb is in the pilot seat, but unless there's an automated flight system on the way (I doubt it), he wont ever have to prove his mettle by landing my spaceplane for me. Understanding that I'm the pilot and my skill is what matters: If I fly 2 different missions with exactly the same craft and same control input, I should get exactly the same results; which would NOT happen if some of the craft's capabilities rely on which Kerbal is at the controls.

Consider the situation where Jeb increases thrust for all SRBs due to his Moar Boosters trait (yay!). On first launch, your rocket gets to orbit (yay!). Even cooler, Jeb's Moar Boosters skill got even better after the first successful mission (yay!). Thinking you have a really good design, you go to launch again. This time, your rocket fails to achieve orbit (huh?). You realize that the SRBs were wasting fuel by pushing too hard against atmosphere now that Jeb is causing them to burn even harder, causing you to lose dV and not achieve orbit (yes, you can have too much thrust). So you have a good laugh at how silly Jeb can be and try Bob, who has the Moar Science trait, instead. You launch but this time you find your SRBs are putting out LESS thrust than your first flight which ALSO causes you not to reach orbit. even though all 3 situations use the same craft (and 2 use the same pilot!), you wind up with 3 different results, only 1 of which is what you planned for in the first place.

This problem extends to craft that I download from someone else. I shouldn't fail to make orbit just because the craft author designed it with a level 100 Kerbal at the helm (which of course is not downloaded with the craft).

Thought about another way, giving Kerbals flight performance statistics means we would end up treating them like just another rocket part. I.E. this kerbal adds .05 torque to reaction wheels and this other kerbal effectively adds a free 10 units of fuel. Maybe this isn't so bad, but I feel that engineering problems should be solved through good design and not because you sat a wily Kerbal in the command chair.

I'm NOT saying I don't want kerbals to gain experience or track individual achievements. I would LOVE that actually. I just don't think they should have any impact on flight characteristics. Instead, find other things for them to be good at: science processing, limit repair actions to engineer-trait kerbals, give additional rep when a famous Kerbal plants a flag, I dunno...

I like the idea of Kerbal xp being more of a qualification system. Rookies start with a base XP to buy their first certificate, and as they earn more they can 'buy' certificates for more qualifications. Certificates could be for various pods or cockpits, operating various experiments, and so on. The "Badass" certificate would be for the external command seat

That's a system I could get behind. Spend XP to get a kerbal's Nuclear Rocket certification, then he can operate an LV-N powered ship.

This all sounds pretty great! Fine Print has been on my must-have mod list since it came out (And was called Extra Contracts).

One thing that I havent seen mentioned in this thread (unless I missed it) is that the upgradable buildings may be hinting at something like Extraplanetary launchpads. It would be really cool if a *very* advanced space program could have an orbital shipyard. Obviously, you'd need to ship fuel and stuff to it, but maybe you'd need to dock an asteroid to it to let it build things? Then asteroids would be *way* more useful!

Rock(et) on, SQUAD!

This update is starting to sound like the sort of thing I've been hoping for for a long time. We need a tweaks update like this to go through and address the plethora of "annoyance" issues that don't completely impact gameplay, but make playing it that much less fun. Also I'm curious to see what upgradable buildings brings with it. Does this mean we may eventually have the ability to build our own space centers elsewhere on Kerbin? *gasp* What about on other planets!?

Seems (unless we have more secret features) that assuming the editor functions are nearly done, that we might get this update in-time for halloween or "____ de la moerte" for squad in Mexico (srry for not remembering completely the name). Maybe if there aren't too many null reference exceptions and such for the testers to discover otherwise we might get it for american Thx giving... this is just personal speculation..

Keep it up, and squash those bugs !

El dÃƒÂ­a is 'the day'. And I think its 'los Muertos'.

So basically...

Once upon a time, SPH and VAB have a little SVPABH (Space Vehicle Plane Assembly Building Hangar) baby. Then VAB says, "Let's go to Laythe, we must not spend the last of our days working for these insane little Kerbals. And that Jeb... He's crazy. Our son will have so much fun working with them," and then SPH says, "Yes, my dear, let us go. SVPABH will have such a nice time working for these . . . fun . . . little Kerbals." Then they have Gus build them some gigantic rockets, and they go fly out to Laythe and live happily ever after. The End.

Please say this happened.
